lead_paragraph: Before he was captured, Joaquín Guzmán Loera met with the actor in his jungle hide-out for seven hours in October and spoke about his empire, Donald Trump and the movie business for Rolling Stone.

byline.contributor: Azam Ahmed contributed reporting from Mexico City.

headline.print_headline: The Drug Lord and the Actor: A Secret Huddle in the Jungle
headline.main: Sean Penn Met With ‘El Chapo’ for Interview in His Hide-Out

snippet: Before he was captured, Joaquín Guzmán Loera met with the actor in his jungle hide-out for seven hours in October and spoke about his empire, Donald Trump and the movie business for Rolling Stone.
abstract: Interviews with Mexican drug lord Joaquin Guzman Loera, also known as El Chapo, conducted by actor and director Sean Penn for Rolling Stone magazine reveal wealth of details about Guzman's life and contain first stark admission that he operates drug empire; interview, released day after Guzman was captured by authorities, is believed to be his first in decades; Guzman's movie ambitions may have had role in his capture.
